maml:description.maml:para: Starts the upgrade of an Azure SQL Database server.

The Start-AzureRmSqlServerUpgrade cmdlet starts the upgrade of an Azure SQL Database server version 11 to version 12. You can monitor the progress of an upgrade by using the Get-AzureRmSqlServerUpgrade cmdlet.
Specifies the name of the resource group the server is assigned to.
Specifies an array of RecommendedDatabaseProperties objects that this cmdlet uses for the server upgrade.
Specifies a collection of UpgradeRecommendedElasticPoolProperties objects to use for the server upgrade. See the examples for information on constructing a sample object.
Specifies the earliest time, using a DateTime object, to upgrade the server. Specify a value in the ISO8601 format, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.
Specifies the name of the server that this cmdlet upgrades.
Specifies the version to which this cmdlet upgrades the server. The only valid value is 12.0.
Specifies an array of RecommendedDatabaseProperties objects that this cmdlet uses for the server upgrade.
Specifies a collection of UpgradeRecommendedElasticPoolProperties objects to use for the server upgrade. See the examples for information on constructing a sample object.
Specifies the name of the resource group the server is assigned to.
Specifies the earliest time, using a DateTime object, to upgrade the server. Specify a value in the ISO8601 format, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.
Specifies the name of the server that this cmdlet upgrades.
Specifies the version to which this cmdlet upgrades the server. The only valid value is 12.0.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Upgrade a server
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Start-AzureRmSqlServerUpgrade -ResourceGroupName "resourcegroup01" -ServerName "server01" -ServerVersion 12.0 ResourceGroupName : resourcegroup01 ServerName : server01 ServerVersion : 12.0 ScheduleUpgradeAfterUtcDateTime : DatabaseCollection :

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command upgrades the server named server01 assigned to resource group resourcegroup01.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Upgrade a server by using schedule time and database recommendation
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $ScheduleTime = (Get-Date).AddMinutes(5).ToUniversalTime() PS C:\> $DatabaseMap = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Azure.Management.Sql.Models.RecommendedDatabaseProperties PS C:\> $DatabaseMap.Name = "contosodb" PS C:\> $DatabaseMap.TargetEdition = "Standard" PS C:\> $DatabaseMap.TargetServiceLevelObjective = "S0" PS C:\> Start-AzureRmSqlServerUpgrade -ResourceGroupName "resourcegroup01" -ServerName "server01" -ServerVersion 12.0 -ScheduleUpgradeAfterUtcDateTime $ScheduleTime -DatabaseCollection ($DatabaseMap)

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command creates a time five minutes in the future by using the Get-Date cmdlet. The command stores the date in the variable $ScheduleTime. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.
The second command creates a RecommendedDatabaseProperties object, and then stores that object in the variable $DatabaseMap.
The next three commands assign values to properties of the object stored in $DatabaseMap.

The final command upgrades the existing server named server01 to version 12.0. The earliest time to upgrade is five minutes after you run the command, as specified by the $ScheduleTime variable. After the upgrade, the database contosodb will be running the Standard edition and have the Service Level Objective S0.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies that a database uses the auditing policy of its hosting server.

The Use-AzureRmSqlServerAuditingPolicy cmdlet specifies that a database uses the auditing policy of its host server. Specify the ResourceGroupName, ServerName, and DatabaseName parameters to identify the database. If no auditing policy is defined for the database server, this cmdlet fails.
If the host uses server level auditing, threat detection is removed.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Use-AzureRmSqlServerAuditingPolicy -ResourceGroupName "resourcegroup01" -ServerName "server02" -DatabaseName "database01"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command specifies that the database named database01 on server02 will use the auditing policy of the server.
